questions.question:
A: おんがくをきくのが好き？
B: うん、ヒップホップ（＿）よくきくよ！
questions.hint: 「AとかB」 is used to give examples and list them. 「ヒップホップとか〜」 means “hip-hop and...”

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
「ヒップホップとかよくきく」 implies hip-hop and possibly other genres.
「とか」 connects items naturally.

  • が - subject marker (not suitable in this context)
  • と - and
  • か - or
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect 😢
The correct answer is とか.

  • が - subject marker (not suitable in this context)
  • と - and
  • か - or

questions.question:
A: あれ、ケーキ？
B: うん、きのう店（＿）買った。
questions.hint: 「〜で買う」 means “to buy at a place.” 「店で買った」 = “bought at the store.”

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉
「店で買った」 is a natural way to say “I bought it at the store.”
「で」 marks the location of the action.

  • に - not used with “buy” here
  • を - marks the object, not place/time
  • が - marks subject
explanation.incorrect:
Incorrect 😢
The correct answer is で.

  • に - not used with “buy” here
  • を - marks the object, not place/time
  • が - marks subject
